item.title: The Bonanza Hotel & Casino: A Short, Turbulent Run on the Las Vegas Strip
item.description:
A Quick Start and Early Troubles

The Las Vegas Strip of the late 1960s was a whirlwind of development, competition, and ambition. Amidst the glitter and promise, the Bonanza Hotel and Casino burst onto the scene on July 1, 1967. Located at 3645 South Las Vegas Boulevard – a prime Strip location now occupied by the Horseshoe – the Bonanza aimed to capture the burgeoning western theme so popular at the time. Situated strategically between the Three Coins and the Galaxy Motel, it even utilized those establishments for overflow lodging, a common practice as the Strip’s resorts grew rapidly.
